metadata.dc:author: González-Gay Mantecón, M A
Márquez Galán, F
Alfonso Bozzo, M J
López Roses, L
Pérez Carnero, A
metadata.dc:description: The association of primary biliary cirrhosis and a scleroderma of the CREST variation is called Reynold's syndrome. The case is presented of a 37 year old patient who appears with a digestive hemorrhage due to rupture of esophagel varices and who showed Raynaud phenomenon, sclerodactylia, positive anticentromere and antimitochondrial antibodies and a hepatic biopsy compatible with stage II of primary biliary cirrhosis.
metadata.dc:title: Síndrome de Reynolds: cirrosis biliar primaria asociada a síndrome de CREST.
[Reynolds syndrome: primary biliary cirrhosis associated with CREST syndrome].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de enfermedades digestivas : organo oficial de la Sociedad Espanola de Patologia Digestiva
